ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: consummate wisdom - but warnings are profitless.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Containing consummate wisdom; yet warnings were of no avail.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: narratives that are full of consummate wisdom. But warnings do not avail them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: but the warnings have proved to have no effect on them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: The pinnacle of wisdom – so how will the Heralds of warning provide any benefit?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Perfect wisdom, but warners benefit them not.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Consummate wisdom-- but warnings do not avail;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: a Wisdom far-reaching; yet warnings do not avail.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Effective wisdom; but warnings avail not.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: profound in wisdom, but all warnings have been of no avail:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Wisdom consummate. But warnings avail not.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: [and representing] far-reaching wisdom; but warnings are of no avail!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Mature wisdom;- but (the preaching of) Warners profits them not.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Perfect wisdom (this Quran), but (the preaching of) warners benefit them not,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: which are full of wisdom; but the warnings do not help.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Profound wisdom—but warnings are of no avail.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Extensive wisdom - but warning does not avail [them].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [54:5] wisdom (hikmatun is the predicate of an omitted subject, or a substitution for mā, ‘such as’, or for muzdajar, ‘deterrent’) [that is] far-reaching, complete; but warnings (nudhur is the plural of nadhīr, functioning in the [agent] sense of mundhir, ‘a warner’, that is to say, ‘those matters which warn them’; mā is either for negation, or it is an interrogative of denial, in which case it stands as a preceding direct object) are of no avail, [warnings] are of no use with them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Effective) is the (wisdom) of the Qur'an; it is wisdom from Allah which they were conveyed on behalf of Allah; (but warnings) i.e. the messengers (avail not) the people who disbelieve in Allah as it is in His preeternal knowledge.
